body.head: Keywords
body.p: These keywords are used for the whole record. You can use one or more of the values provided for key. You can assign as many keywords as needed. This means that it is not necessary to limit the keywords to the principal text, but keywords for any additional or minor texts contained in the manuscript should also be assigned. Always assign a period keyword, using the keywords referring to Ethiopian literary periods only in records actually belonging to the Ethiopian tradition. The keywords "ChristianLiterature", "IslamicLiterature" and "BetaEsraelLiterature" should be assigned to all records belonging to these traditions.
You can use term also in other parts of the files where the schema allows it. In the following example term is used in a decoNote but you can use it also in additions

decoNote.desc: The runs between and is placed under brightly coloured arches that rest on curtained columns. Several birds are palced atop the arch. The opening page, features a pair of ጣዎስ፡ flanking a cross and four ዱራ፡ birds. The following pages feature the ጠይራት፡ birds on arches decorated with patterns.

body.p: The values available for key have to be also in the taxonomy.
